transcript.content: John Lennon, and Yoko Ono, “Happy Christmas, War is Over” on Radio 2. I'm Ricky Gervais  with me, Steve Merchant.
Karl Pilkington, but more about Karl later, we’ll have to - we want introduce the world to Karl, don't we?
It's extraordinary to think that they’re people yet they have not experienced Karl.
A whole new audience is gonna discover -
I think of me and Stephen as like, Anthony Hopkins in “The Elephant Man”.
Just taking Karl round the country - the World.
Maybe just letting - maybe some doctors and surgeons might want to, uh, after today certainly -
We just drop a sheet, he’s there, nude, and they can just ask him questions, examine him, see what makes him tick.
You know uhh, that is Karl's favorite film, by the way, “The Elephant Man”. He said - he loves it.
He said, “One”, he said, “the title tells you exactly what you're going to get.”

He loved that, right? He said, “Two, it's sad”. And I was saying, “Why is it sad?” He said, “Well there’s that bit where they take him to show all the surgeons. And the Elephant Man is all naked and that, and the bloke goes, “the genitals are normal”. And Karl went, “Think of that. The one thing you would want like an elephant, and he gets the head.” That's why he thought it was sad.
That’s the kind of mind process of Karl, which we’ll introduce to you later, in the meantime -
Well, yeah, you know, if you're expecting Jonathan Ross, then you’re gutted.
You probably know me from such works as; The Office, Extras, Alias.

Karl uhh, you don't know about, Steven is, is more familiar. Stephen co-wrote and directed “The Office” and “Extras” with me, um. You may have seen him in “Extras” as the agent, uh, you may have seen him briefly in “The Office”. He is - a goggle-eyed freak.
You’re referring to the character there, are you, or?
I'm just trying to paint a picture for people, at Christmas.
Yeah. I wouldn’t say goggle-eyed, I think google-eyed freaks harsh, you know, these are pretty - these are designer specs. And yeah, I admittedly, I'm, I’m a little bit tall but uhh-
Yeah, but let’s not have a go at that.
Karl, we've got more like this later, I think we should play a record. We've done introductions -
Yeah, pop a little song on
But do you remember - the first time you saw Steve?
Well, let's, let's pop a little song ‘a that, right? Chat about it in a bit.
Bruce Springsteen, “Santa Claus is Coming to Town”
Bruce Springsteen, Santa Claus is Coming to Town. Merry Christmas everyone.
I'm Ricky Gervais, with me, Steve Merchant.

And uh, Karl Pilkington. If you have tuned in to hear Jonathan, it's the last time I’ll mention him, we haven't got him today. You've got us for the next couple of Saturdays. I feel like a step-father.
You know what I mean? I want to say to the listener. “You know, I’ll never replace Daddy.”
“But I am here and I, and I’ll do my best for you and I love you.”
On the other hand I want to go, “Listen, I'm doing mummy now. Live with it.”
Yeah, yeah. No, that's, that's exactly right. Yeah. And hopefully that people will appreciate us and enjoy us just as much as Jonathan.
I don't care if they don't.
In fact, I intend to shave millions of listeners off this by the end of the 2 hours -
But, the ones that have stayed listening to the end, they’ll love it.
And I think I've got to go have Christmas dinner with them tomorrow anyway, so, I could just have a chat -
So we're introducing ourselves. I’m Ricky Gervais, Steve Merchant, Karl Pilkington
And y'know, you put a lot of thought into buying presents, don't you when you're a kid because you know, you haven't got that much money to spend an' that.
So you look like you did but you had hair I assume?
Yep, right. So eight years old an' that, I'm putting a bit of planning into it thinking 'Oh, you know, what does- what will me mam want?'
Now me mam's a big fan of er... gnomes
She must be pleased how you turned out
-and fairies and stuff like that, right? Little elves and all that stuff, right?
So I thought, right? I'll look for something that's, that's, a bit gnomish.
And there was this shop- there was this- there was this- there was this shop sort of down the road that, umm, sort of sold a lot of tat right?
Umm, Sort of- you know one of them shops where everything's quite cheap, it's... sort of they sell things individually, that shouldn't be like, toilet rolls, and...
They used to be called 'everything's a pound' but now there's some that are 'everything's 99p'.
Because a pound wasn't cheap enough.

So anyway. So I had a look in there thinking, 'right, let's have a look and see if they've got any gnomes an' that' and the closest thing they 'ad, right? Was uh, this, this figure that's called uh, a Victoria Plum.
No, Victoria Plum, get it right
It's like little-  it's like a- it's like a woman gnome, right?

So I thought 'Oh she'll love that, right?' So save that- I think it was about two quid, right? Invest in one of them; take it home, I'm well chuffed in myself an' that; wrapping it up, pop it under the tree thinking I can't wait to see her face light up when she sees this.
Anyway, you know like when you're a kid- I bought that like two weeks before Christmas.
Right. And you know, when you're sort of excited you want to give someone a present earlier, d' y'know what I mean?

I- I- I sort of took me mam into this shop. Aright? And we're just walking about, and the Victoria Plum was sort of there on the shelf. And I said to her, I said, 'Oh,' I said 'look at that up there, do you like that?' She said 'no, it's bloody horrible.' Right?
Ricky and Steve exclaim in horror
So this is- it's too late, it's too late to go back.
It's wrapped, I've- money's spent, it's wrapped, it's under the tree. Alright,
I'm thinking, 'Oh, I can't believe it.' So I said 'no that-' y'know, made sure she's looking at the right thing- I said 'No, that- that little gnome woman.' - 'Yeah, it's horrible.'
She opens hers an' that and she went 'oh, that's- that's lovely, that' I said 'No- uh- don't give me that,' d' y'know what I mean? 'you said you thought it was horrible-'
You thought she was a liar.
For pretending, for not wanting to hurt your feelings, she was a liar.
And that's.. you know, that's... that's why, y'know-
What're you on about? Yeah, but you don't forget, do ya?
You- I don't- I still don't know how this justifies you not buying your girlfriend of 11 years, an actual gift.
Play a Christmas song, I'm welling up.
Frank Sinatra - Let Me Try Again
Let Me Try Again, by Frank Sinatra. Beautiful song.
On, er, BBC Radio 2. Well, it's that time of year when we give- give gifts.
Right I'm making a note of this.
I've got it. I've got it.
Right. Put that on a spider's house. Right? Second one, Diana Ross isn't feeling that good. Right?
Yeah, that's the clue - I.D. Right? Diana Ross isn't feeling that sort-of good at the moment.
Different different. How can it be cryptic if the clues different the next time?
Diana Ross isn't feeling that good I.D.
That stuff that I put on my toast, right?
It doesn't taste sharp enough. Right? That stuff I put on my toast - aww (makes tasting noises). It doesn't taste, doesn't taste sharp enough right.
Bob Holness eat your heart out.
The initials J.B. Alright, so there you go, there's three Clues.
Right! I've got that, and it doesn't work!
Karl and Steve talk over each other
Hang on a sec Karl, let me give out how these people can get in touch.
Because I know you're excited to do the clues again.
You can text us 88-2-91. You can give us a call 0500-2-88-2-91 or you can email gervais@bbc.co.uk. The clues again then Karl.
Well quickly, that information card, you get on your mobile, just pop it on a spider's house. That's S.W.
Second one - Diana, Ross isn't, isn't, you know, feeling that good at the moment what's up with her?
And then the last one - that stuff I put on my toast doesn't sort of taste sharp enough, right? It's going on there, J.B.

T-Rex Christmas Bop on Radio 2, after the news we've got the answers to Rockbusters. Good luck with that, still time to get those answers in. Plus we've also got some more stuff to give away, second competition, and, of course Monkey News. If you've never had a monkey news before, you will not believe your luck, it is truly extraordinary Rick am I right?
You are, but this is the real news on 88 to 91 FM. This is Radio 2 from the BBC.

Talk by Coldplay. And we've got some Coldplay stuff to give away in this in the second hour, coming up soon. Some Collectibles and some signed stuff - albums and everything. But this is the Madonna one, we're playing for the Madonna gold disc
Is that better or better than [inaudible]?
Well it's a goal one but I just got the shop to put, write, platinum on it.
Yeah, so it's a wonderful gift, so whoever wins this is sorted out and we got some other stuff that me and Steve have made, for you, as well. So Karl give us the clues again and the answers.
This is it Karl, this is the final moment where we actually get to see how your mind works.
And you've got a winner and everything [inaudible]. Right, first one was  - you know that that little card you get in your mobile? Yeah you put that?
Yeah, okay so I got that one.
Yeah so it's web. It's SIM-on-web.
SIM-on-web - I've never heard of 'im. I've never heard of SIM-on-web.
The gift of chat, the gift of Rockbusters..
To the nation, you cannot buy that, you can't bottle it.. If- I'd like to see him bottled
Yeah.. exactly yeah.. he will be one day, he will be in Ripleys-
And they'll say he used to walk round amongst us
But uh.. let's not forget why erm- why we give gifts
We- Well yeah.. just to cheer people up and that
Ye.. well no it's because the wise men
Gave gifts to the.. Baby Jesus
What would you have got the Baby Jesus, I'd have probably have gotten him tokens..
And let him decide cause it's very- do y'know what I mean, you don't wanna get anything- yknow.. and he doesn't like it and he wants to take it back
Well I'll tell you in a recent poll Waterstones did, the favourite gift for children was Flanimals.. Still available
That's so outrageous, that's so disgraceful, it's Christmas eve..
What would you have got him then?!
I don't make any money from Flanimals
I like the uh.. I like the uh.. fact that uh.. one of the wise men turned up with gold uhh and the other two.. frankincense and myrrh
Which as I understand it is what? Some- It's like some incense or something? Incense or perfume?
I think I believe that's what it is
I just love the idea that one of them- look they've all gotten together and they've gone "Okay now guys we're not gonna spend more than 50 quid each this year alright?"
Definitely not.. So what have you all got- before we go in and see him what have you all got?
Uh... I uh... I spent a bit more than 50
What are you talking about man? We just said- We weren't.. We weren't g- we all said- we were just gonna whip round and get him something cheap like a token
Got him.. just.. Nah... Got him some gold
Well I'm trying to make an impression.. he's the son of God!
But I did... No- We only got- Frank- I got frankincense
And what did the other fella get?
He got myrrh and I don't even know what that is and I'm a wise man
He'd have been- Surely one of them must have been furious
Is myrrh still popular..? Golds still very.. popular
Well I hope so cause that's what my Grans getting this year
Right well- thats the- thats- thats why we give gifts
Do y'know- like how he got them gifts.. right? little Baby Jesus
Were they for Christmas or his birthday
Radio 2 indeed, right there- you heard the uh Pogues - Fairy tail of New York..
One of the best Christmas songs ever.. I think THE best Christmas song ever
And one of the best songs ever!
It's uh- it's brilliant, do you like that Karl?
Uhh.. what being here- and that?
Yeah.. it's uh... It's alright, I mean we're getting looked after and that
I can't believe- like.. yknow the amount of food and that we've got here.. it's mental
Yeah, mince pies.. fruit.. it's all going on
Yeah, it's like- like a little harvest festival going on
Where you take the pineapple chunks for an old lady
But uhhh.. but yeah- it's- it's going alright.. I mean I've been- I've sort of been listening to Radio 2 y'know the last few weeks
And enjoying it and that and sort of.. y'know.. making sure we get the show right
Y'know what I mean.. we want it to fit into everybody else's.. shows and that
This fits into uh.. everybody else's shows.. this is... Oh yeah, this is.. this is great this show, this is perfect
Listen again of course on BBC..
Yeah, so reversible. That's why they died out. Like the dinosaur, like the dinosaur, Karl. We didn't need them.
Didn't need them. Still be here if we needed them. Well they're bringing back a mammoth, though, aren't they?
Yeah, they are bringing back the mammoth
But listen, you know, we're chatting about presents and all that. And before my little, my little thought of the day about
Just, you know, cheer someone up if you can.
I mean, it's a nice sentiment, but it's okay. Go on.
Well, it's, there's an old woman who lives
Who lives next door to me mam and dad.

Alright, and this is what I mean about you know, the old people, they might not have that many people cheering them up this time of year, so you know, if you can get them a little gift an' that because - what happened was, this old woman, living next door to me mam and dad.
This, this was only about two years ago.

All right, and, I think her son's left home, doesn't keep in touch, you know, doesn't even phone her, I don't think an' that, quite sad. And I thought I'll give her a bit of me time. I'll have a chat with her, try and cheer her up and stuff.

And uh, I said "alright, how's it going?" Said "yeah, not bad. I need a new dishwasher." All right, I was going "yeah, yeah". And she was saying, "but I don't get a chance to get out these days, you know, I can't get about like I did" and, and all that. I was going "Yeah, it's bad that". Anyway, I go to like one of those big super stores where they sell all electrical stuff and that. Right? I'm in there. I think I'll get her a little catalog so she can have a look. All right, got back. Gave her that, said "there you go. while i was in the superstore I got you a little catalog so you can have a look at dishwashers an' that"
She's over the moon, she still goes on about it, it was years ago,
What that you got her a catalog?
I thought you said you were gonna buy her a dishwasher?
No, no just just the catalog, an' that.
But that your life is sort of like just Bittersweet tragedy.
I know, but it is though, because you've got on this street and there's there's people knocking around with them big heads and webbed hands and webbed feet that, I mean, that must have.
Well, she's pretty weird anyway, this old woman because she was
No, no. Well, after I got of the catalog, and that

She opened up a bit and she was saying now, you know, she's a bit odd anyway because she woke up one morning with blood sort, sort of  falling on her head from a dead rabbit hanging over her. So I mean, she's a nice
That's what she went on to, she sort of opened up a bit and
What street-what street were you born in? Where is this place?
Is it Elm Street that you live on?
She's just said that her mam was a witch or something. So it was like,
Oh, well that's normal, her mam was a witch that's normal
Well, it's just a bit odd, innit? But you know, I mean but but talking about like, where I live and all that

One story that, I've told you before and everyone's like "that didn't happen", alright? Just a couple of houses, sort of down, from where I lived there was this family who uh, had a horse in their house.

They had uh, they had like a horse in their house. I'd been out, with me dad, and I drove back into the uh, me dad was driving it back into the avenue- sorta went down to the bottom to turn around, to get back to our house.
Did a little glance and I saw this

Put an advert in a local paper, I think it was in Sheffield, saying, um: "I've been reincarnated. I was a cow at the birth of Jesus. Is anyone else out there that was reincarnated who was at the birth of Jesus?" Fella got in touch, said "I was a cow too" and they started a society called Cattle for Christ.
Just the two of them. I don't know where they held their annual General meetings.
I wonder if that's still going?

I don't know. But imagine if you were at the birth of Christ, and they're going "oh, do you remember it?" and he goes "yeah, but I couldn't quite see, there was just a bit of wood in the- yeah, I didn't really see that. I remember the men, they were arguing over spending"
"all I could see was your backside"

I know - yeah. So, uh, think of that, Karl. Okay, final question, right? Okay. Karl, if you could travel back in time to ancient Rome and take one modern invention with you, to set yourself up as a god-king, what would it be? What would you take back? That's from Amy. Sorry, Arvy, Arvy in London.
Yeah, so what would you take back to make sure that you were king. That, you know, would it be a weapon? Would it be, you know..?
Yeah, a weapon. It was pretty violent times, wasn't it? Yeah, I'll have a weapon if that's-
Gun, I'd have a gun, take that.
And what would you do with it once you were there?
Well it's- I'd probably, I mean, I don't like killing animals, but those, they used to use tigers a lot so shoot one of them in the head
No explanation for it, I just- I love him. Okay, look, we've gotta give this, who, um, can Karl do something to prove you're live
You completely foxxed him. There was nothing he could think of in his tiny little brain to prove that this is live.
So I think little Jason wins the Coldplay Collectibles and some other stuff, so well done. It's- He still can't prove it. He still can't prove it
Play a tune then we'll have some Monkey News
You could've just said, you could've just picked up today's paper and read the headline, think!

Karl, we have just had a communique from Gillian Oliver, who's the communications director for the Church of England. Okay, she wants to take you up on your offer. She would like to take you up to Manchester and let you give a sermon
Well, don't you think that's ama- she's, she's the- in charge of the press and Communications for the Church of England. And she wants, you've got to do this Karl.
For my sake, I'll go to church. If you do this.

I've been I didn't really like it. I had to go once to church and it was years ago when I was a kid and I swore, right? And me mate Jamie said: "Right? If you don't come with me to church-" because he was Catholic he had to go "-So if you don't, if you don't come with me now, I'm going to tell your mam that you swore an' that"
That's likely to get people into church
So I went, right? Didn't enjoy it. An' I got sort of got kicked out in the end because I was bouncing with tennis ball in the aisle, and it rolled down
Well I better tell Gillian Oliver that that may happen again

That's the- if you don't take your yo-yo or your Nintendo, you've got to do it. I'm going to make sure. We want a campaign. Please email us if you want Kyle to do a sermon. And I mean I'm sure we can film this and put it on the web for you to see. Oh, please do it.

Well listen. We've barely got any time now for monkey news. Now a lot people are probably unfamiliar with Monkey News because this is the first time we've been on Radio 2. Uh, Rick, how would you summarize monkey news? I mean, obviously, Karl is fascinated by monkey
Karl believes everything he reads, he goes on websites-

Websites with... that don't get verified at all. It's mostly nonsense. But he believes it because there's about monkeys doing incredible things. And and Karl thinks that, you know, monkeys can one day talk. He wants to live in the Planet of the Apes basically.
He thinks The Flintstones is a documentary and and go karl. Let's do monkey news jingle. Do the jingle live.
Right, well, I thought we'd go for sort of a Christmas feel.
Alright. So this one, it's-it happened in Stockholm, right, a couple of years ago round the Christmas time.
A little Grotto set up and stuff, right? And it was getting busier and busier. This little grotto. There was only one in Stockholm, right. Queue was massive and stuff...
That's not, but that's not true. Couple of years ago- if you'd have said a thousand years ago.
Yeah it was busy and that, and there was this bloke. There was this bloke who had a kid. And the kid was saying "dad!", you know,
"can I go and see" you know, "Father Christmas in The Grotto".
And he's like, "ah, I don't want to join that queue, it's too big", right? And and loads of the father Christmas's who was in the booth, they kept jacking it in, because the queue was that big.
What do you mean loads of Father Christmases in the booth? What booth?
Because they got through loads and in the Grotto, the Father Christmas and that, right? They couldn't hack the pressure of the queues, the queues were massive for this grotto.
So they kept getting through like, loads of Father Christmases.
People who kept saying "I can't handle this, you'll have to get a new one in", right.

Anyway, so this fella right? The kid kept asking every day - "can we go in there" he said "no look the queue's big". Anyway, one day the queue was suddenly a lot shorter, right? Because they've got a new little Father Christmas fella'.
NO, right. KARL if this Father Christmas turns out to be about three foot six and hairy...

So anyway, right, so he's going, "come on then we'll join the queue". Right. So he joins the queue and, you know, the queue's going down really fast. People are going in and out really quick, and he's going "how's he managing to do this?", right?
And it sort of looks through the curtain he can just be a little slight thing.
And he can see the bloke who's like dressed up as Father Christmas - he's handing them out with his hands and his feet and that right
I'm going to die! I'm going to die! Oh God!
Please don't interrupt the news, rick I want to hear the-lets just...

So he's queuing up, right? And he's going "oh he's good. Good on him, and he's got a new method of handing out the presents and that" whilst he's queueing there, there's a little fella' selling chestnuts. So he thinks "I'll buy some of them" and err-
You know, something to munch on while still in the queue and stuff.
And so anyways queuing up, he's eating the chestnuts, comes to his turn.
So to cut a long story short, you reckon that they hired a chimp to hand out presents? Father Christmas [inaudible].
And so he brought the chestnuts in and the monkey attacked him and ate the nuts?
Well he went off right? And he's going "why's it all going mad" and that.
And there's a Little fella. There's a little fella just sat there there with like a little beard on and that?
Ricky and Karl try and talk at the same time.

No. No it's not [inaudible] carry on because again it's absolute rubbish. That didn't happen. There's no way they'd hire a chimp and there's no way people go... THEY'D NOTICE. THEY'D SEE IT WAS A CHIMP!
Right, forget it then. that they do is they see it was a joke.
It's absolute rubbish. If you want to find out more about Karl, what's the website address Karl?
And we've drawn-I've drawn a little picture that you can win a Karl and it really sums him up.

synopsis.description: Karl tells a Dickensian story about buying his mother a Victoria Plum Gnome for Christmas.
Monkey News: The Father Christmas grotto.
